name: src/Animator.js
Animator
description: Interface defining the behavior animated objects should implement.

name: animate
description: Main callback method.

name: invokeAnimationHandler
description: Whether or not the animated method is defined externally, as when register it through reflection.

name: animationPeriod
description: Returns the animation period in milliseconds.

name: setAnimationPeriod
description: Sets the animation `period` in milliseconds and (optional) `restart` the animation.

name: stopAnimation
description: Stops the animation

name: startAnimation
description: Starts the animation executing periodically the animated call back method.

name: restartAnimation
description: Simply calls {@link Animator#stopAnimation} and then {@link Animator#startAnimation}.

name: toggleAnimation
description: Starts or stops the animation according to {@link Animator#animationStarted}.

name: animationStarted
description: Return `true` if animation was started or `false` otherwise.

name: setTimingHandler
description:
Sets the timing handler.
param {TimingHandler} handler

name: timingHandler
description: Returns the timing handler.

name: timer
description: Returns the sequential timer.

name: src/AnimatorObject.js
AnimatorObject
description: Class implementing the main {@link Animator} behavior.

name: constructor
description: Constructs an animated object with a default {@link AnimatorObject#animationPeriod} of 40 milliseconds (25Hz), if no handler is supplied, the handler should explicitly be defined afterwards {@link AnimatorObject#setTimingHandler}.

name: src/SeqTimer.js
SeqTimer
description: Sequential timers are single-threaded timers handled by a TimingHandler.

name: constructor
description: Defines a sequential (single-threaded) timer.

params.name: options
params.description: defines the handler, singleShot and task options

params.name: options.runOnlyOnce
params.description: Defines a single shot sequential (single-threaded) timer

params.name: options.task
params.description: if not null, register a callback task

name: execute
description:
Executes the callback method defined by the {@link SeqTimer#timingTask}.
*Note:* You should not call this method since it's done by the timing handler (see {@link TimingHandler#handle}).

name: inactivate
description: Deactivates the SeqTimer.

name: triggered
description:
Returns `true` if the timer was triggered at the given frame.
*Note:* You should not call this method since it's done by the timing handler
(see {@link TimingHandler#handle}).

name: src/Taskable.js
Taskable
description: Interface used to define a timer callback method.

name: execute
description: Timer callback method

name: src/Timer.js
Timer
description: Interface defining timers.

name: run
description: Sets the optional period and runs the timer according to {@link Timer#period}. The timer may be scheduled for repeated fixed-rate execution according to {@link Timer#isSingleShot}.

params.name: period
params.description: time in milliseconds between successive task executions

name: timingTask
description: Returns the object defining the timer callback method. May be null.

name: stop
description: Stops the timer.

name: cancel
description: Stops the timer.

name: create
description: Creates the timer.

name: isActive
description: Tells whether or not the timer is active.

name: period
description: Returns the timer period in milliseconds.

name: setPeriod
description: Defines the timer period in milliseconds.

name: isSingleShot
description: Returns whether or not the timer is scheduled to be executed only once.

name: setSingleShot
description: Defines the timer as a single shot or for repeated execution.

name: src/TimingHandler.js
TimingHandler
description:
A timing handler holds a {@link TimingHandler#timerPool} and an {@link TimingHandler#animatorPool}. The timer
pool are all the tasks scheduled to be performed in the future (one single time or
periodically). The animation pool are all the objects that implement an animation
callback function. For an introduction to FPSTiming please refer to {@link fpstiming}

name: constructor
description: Constructor that optionally takes and registers an animation object.

name: handle
description:
Handler's main method. It should be called from within your main event loop. It does
the following: 1. Recomputes the frame rate; 2. Executes the all timers (those in the
{@link TimingHandler#timerPool}) callback functions; and, 3. Performs all the animated objects
(those in the {@link TimingHandler#animatorPool}) animation functions.

name: timerPool
description: Returns the timer pool.

name: registerTask
description: Register a task in the timer pool and creates a sequential timer for it with an optional timer.

name: unregisterTask
description: Unregisters the timer. You may also unregister the task this timer is attached to.

name: isTaskRegistered
description: Returns `true` if the task is registered and `false` otherwise.

name: updateFrameRate
description:
Recomputes the frame rate based upon the frequency at which {@link TimingHandler#handle} is
called from within the application main event loop. The frame rate is needed to sync
all timing operations.

name: frameRate
description:
Returns the approximate frame rate of the software as it executes. The initial value
is 10 fps and is updated with each frame. The value is averaged (integrated) over
several frames. As such, this value won't be valid until after 5-10 frames.

name: frameCount
description: Returns the number of frames displayed since the program started.

name: animatorPool
description: Returns all the animated objects registered at the handler.

name: registerAnimator
description: Registers the animation object.

name: unregisterAnimator
description: Unregisters the animation object.

name: isObjectAnimator
description:
Returns `true` if the animation object is registered and `false`
otherwise.

name: src/TimingTask.js
TimingTask
description:
An abstract wrapper class holding a {@link TimingTask#timer} together with its callback method
( {@link Taskable#execute}) which derived classes should implement.

name: timer
description: Returns the timer instance.

name: setTimer
description: Sets the timer instance.

name: run
description: Run the {@link TimingTask#timer} with a repeated fixed-rate execution according to `period`.

name: runOnce
description: Run the {@link TimingTask#timer} once, according to `period`.

name: stop
description: Stops the {@link TimingTask#timer}.

name: cancel
description: Stops the {@link TimingTask#timer}.

name: create
description: Creates the {@link TimingTask#timer}.

name: isActive
description: Tells whether or not the timer is active.

name: src/index.js
